intro: Oritrophium callacallense, commonly known as the Andean goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountainous climates. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oritrophium callacallense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in Andean medicine.
